long.para: opd(q, a ,b) decomposes a quaternion array element-by-element q into two components in orthogonal planes defined by a and b using the formulae p = ½(q + aqb) and m = ½(q - aqb). The third parameter is optional, if omitted it is set equal to the second. If a is a pure quaternion, and b is omitted, p is parallel to a, and m is in the plane normal to a. (Parallel/perpendicular decomposition.) Other cases are determined by the values of the second and third parameters. Coxeter's paper is recommended as a reference for details of the geometry.
